page.title: 04A Day in the Life of Helen
page.content: A typical day starts for me at 7am. I have tea and toast for breakfast then I get dressed in school uniform which is red and white. The school day usually starts with an assembly in which we are told interesting stories and notices are given out. Our school is an open plan building so that children and teachers can work together across the two bases of the same year. Most of our work is topic work so maths, writing and artwork is all included in it. We write our work in rough work books and when it has been read by the teacher we copy it up in best on paper and put it in booklets which we make ourselves. Most of the time we get on with our work independently, so while some children are doing maths others may be getting on with writing, artwork, stories, sewing or making booklets.
